title: Best practices of creating custom applications and record types with Studio
content:
A checklist of creating an application in the real world

This section lists some ideas and steps when trying to create an application in the real world. Depending on your own business needs, you may consider using some or all of them as a checklist.

Identify and document the use cases to be supported by the application

  1. Consider what the application should be called and where it would fit into the mega menu.
  2. Consider how records will be created via the Agent UI, that is, from a request from the Service Portal or via a business rule.
  3. Consider which roles will need to access the application.
  4. Consider if the application will use Approvals.
  5. Consider if the application requires any Notifications.
  6. Consider if the application requires any Service Level Targets.
  7. Consider if the application requires any Reports and Dashboards.

Design the application

  1. Consider if you need multiple Entity Types.
  2. Determine the Meta Phases for each Entity Type. Important: Meta phases can't be changed after creation.
  3. Design the Process Phases for each Entity Type.
  4. Determine the Fields needed for each Entity Type in conjunction with a high-level Forms design.
    1. Consider the different types of fields required, for example, RFT, Double, and Entity Links.
    2. Consider the interaction with other Entries. Do you need 1:N or N:N relationships?
    3. Consider what ENUM fields are needed. Important: ENUM fields can't be deleted after creation.
  5. Determine the Business Rules that are required to support your use cases.
  6. Determine the additional Roles required.
  7. Determine any changes to the OOTB Roles.

Build the application

Note: We suggest that you create Business Rules at a later phase.

  1. Create required Menu and Entity Records.
  2. Create Meta and Process Phases.
  3. Create List (ENUM) Fields as required.
  4. Create all required Fields.
  5. Create all Forms.
  6. Activate Entity Records.

Test the application

Fix the issues at the "Build the application" phase.

Refine the application

  1. Add Business Rules as required.
  2. Add Business Rules for items such as Read Only or Mandatory Fields.
  3. If an Entity Type is created via another Entity, create required Business Rules.
  4. If an Entity Type is created via a Request Offering, add the Request Offering and create an automated Task Plan. Note: You need to consider if the catalog structure supports this offering.
  5. Add any Approvals as required.
  6. Add any Service Level Targets as required.
  7. Add any Notifications as required.

Test the application

Perform an end-to-end test and fix the issues at the "Refine the application" phase.

Finalize the application

  1. Create new Roles or update existing Roles.
  2. Create Reports and Dashboards as required.

Test the application

Conduct a role-based test and fix the issues at the "Finalize the application" phase.

Document

Establish a documentation for all the customization you have made.

Package and deploy

  1. Create a Package.
  2. Deploy the Package in the target Tenant.
  3. Manually make the necessary configurations.

Studio best practices

The Studio best practices help you create your own applications and record types with Studio and consist of the following sections.

  • Before you start
  • Naming conventions
  • Creating your application
  • Cross module modifications

See Related topics at the bottom of this page for details.

Studio tutorial

With the Studio tutorial, you will create a training application that allows instructors to define the available courses, schedule specific classes, and track the students in these classes (and even grade their performance).

The tutorial itself is split into multiple parts. In part one, you will design and implement the needed record types for the application and the roles needed to control them. The components built in this section will be new to the system and completely self-contained.

Part two of the tutorial will expand the application to allow end users to sign up for specific classes using the Service Catalog.

See Related topics at the bottom of this page for details.
